title: üáπüáø Unguja Zanzibar Tanzania
text: The quarantine Hakuna Matata trip to the Southern Hemisphere in New Year.

title: Intro
text: **Unguja** is the main üèùÔ∏è island of the Zanzibar archipelago. **Zanzibar** archipelago is an island part of üáπüáø Tanzania (Zanzibar city is the only city on the Unguja island). **Tanzania** is a country in üåç East Africa. But people use to refer to Unguja island as Zanzibar.
During the üò∑ coronavirus, many countries closed their borders or restricted their visiting, but Tanzania is open, that's why many tourists choose this country to visit.
If you want to visit Tanzania's mainland (there are some safari tours there) you should be aware of diseases like ü¶ü Malaria and Yellow fever.
But for the island, üåû the sun is a more dangerous thing, because it's easy to completely be burnt in hours even if you are mostly in the shadow. The equator is not so far from here.

title: Beaches
text: Probably the main reason why the majority of tourists want to visit Unguja is üèñÔ∏è the beaches.
I have visited only three beaches: **Kendwa** (northeast), **Nungwi** (north), and **Paje** (east).

title: Transport
text: But beaches are not the only interesting thing to visit on the island. You can use local transport to go to other places. If you don't want to rent a car or motorbike you cab basically use three types of transport: üöï **private taxi**, üöå **public bus** and üí® **dala dala**.

title: Places
text: You can visit other beaches and other interesting points on the island.

These places usually have local guides to hire. Also, if you don't want to visit it by yourself you can buy a tour. But the tours are usually a combination of the local guide, the transport (a car or a boat) and sometimes some food. Bargain skills are important to buy it at a normal price.

title: Bargain
text: Every time you spend üíµ money you have to bargain with locals. It's really important for them. It's a kind of traditional way of modern marketing with discounts in the shop. People want not only to buy something, but they also want to feel the benefit. That's why discounts are important nowadays. But the bargain is a kind of a two-side discount. Also, it looks like two side auction with the theater elements.

To show how it's important I can provide you an example. Somebody offers something for 100 000 tsh (~$45), but he is ready to sell it for 50 000 tsh (~$22.5). If you offer to buy it for 50 000 tsh (~$22.5) in the beginning he will definitely refuse it. But if you offer to buy it for 25 000 tsh (~11.25) and then he decreases his offer price and you increase yours he will be glad to sell it for 50 000 tsh (~$22.5) in the end. So 50 000 tsh (~$22.5) is not a good price for the seller, but 50 000 tsh (~$22.5) **with a bargain** is a good price.
It's like a game when the seller not only changes the good for the money but interacts with the buyer a lot.

But it also has another side. If you can't do it well you feel cheated all the time. They start with really big prices and laugh when you offer the real ones, but then decrease theirs. And sometimes there is a situation (for example, they have not many goods) they can üôÖ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è refuse any offers.

title: Other
text: It seems the overbooking is a pretty common thing here. We didn't live in a hotel that was booked, because it was busy. And we had to wait for several hours until our hotel will have been replaced with another one. It's not the best feeling where you are in another hemisphere with winter clothes (üå°Ô∏è the temperature is +30 ¬∞C here), cash in the pockets, with all the baggage but without the place to sleep. But a few days ago we realized it was not only our case here.

It so unusual to celebrate üéâ the New Year in a country like this. First of all, the atmosphere - there is no ‚ùÑÔ∏è snow and üéÑ Christmas trees there. But the more important thing is local people don't actually celebrate it here. So, the holiday you use to consider as global and worldwide is only your holiday here (and other tourists from countries like yours). At this moment you understand how far are you from home.
If you stayed not in the expensive hotel with all-inclusive you switch between two conditions all the time here:
1. Everything is so cool, I can't believe it's real.
2. Why is it happening with me, can anybody stop it?

This is the place where the üß± hotel wall can separate different people having dinner for $1 and $100. It's a place full of contrasts. For example, the island has problems with ‚ö° electricity. It can be turned off several times per day, and nobody knows when will it work again. Sometimes it's felt like you are in a pretty wild place. I am not sure is there üè• a hospital at all.

But people are kind and positive and smile all the time. Even when they try to chea–µ you) And this is pretty common here (üçπ the drinks become more expensive when you ask for the check because of the "party time", the private boat with bigger price can become public, and the change can be forgotten). But when you note it to them they usually fix the problem without any conflicts.
Also, it's unusual to see African people who are Muslims. I don't know why. Maybe I haven't traveled enough before or not educated enough.

Anyway, it's interesting not to bring your culture to the place you traveling to, but to dive into the local's life, to eat the local food, to go out of üõãÔ∏è the comfort zone. Traveling is a much more interesting thing than simply resting in another country.
It's an interesting place. It's easy to find more comfort for this money in other places. But there are many things you can't find elsewhere.
And it's unbelievable that you can turn on the hot summer anytime in the year. But it has the other side. You have to return to the country without the smiles after all.

title: üè° From Brest to Naliboki forest and back
text: The last winter weekend south-west Belarus trip.

title: Sviciaz lake
text: Sviciaz lake was the first nature point during our trip. Don't mix it up with the Ukrainian lake with the same name 250 km south-west.
This is the beautiful lake in the forest. There are a lot of legends related to this lake. For example, the legend of the origin:

> In the XIII century the town of Svityaz, ruled by Prince Turan, stood on the site of the lake. During the war with the Russian (Volyn) princes Mindauh called Svityazh's squad to help defend Navahrudak. Turan, obeying his duty, left the city for women, the elderly, and children.

> When the enemy army approached Svityaz, the inhabitants decided to resist, but not being able to hold the city, they set fire to their houses. At this point, the city collapsed into a lake that formed in its place. All the inhabitants turned into flowers, and the enemies who touched them died. So the inhabitants of Svityaz escaped the shame of captivity.

title: Hraptovichy palace in Shchorsy
text: The main attraction of the village of Shchorsy are fragments of an extensive palace complex with a large park and ponds. Most of the buildings that belonged to the palace and park complex in the village of Shchorsy were built in the second half of the 18th and 19th centuries.

The palace itself, built in 1776, has not survived to this day, only the cellars remained. In addition to the palace itself, in the 19th century there were many different economic, residential and administrative buildings. Many of these secondary buildings have been preserved to some extent to this day.
Unfortunately, we didn't stop here to take a photo and had a quick look from the road. Probably it's not the best place to visit in ‚ùÑÔ∏è winter.

title: Kroman lake
text: It was the hardest part of our trip. The unpaved road with snow and mud started. In the beginning, we thought it should be not really long part. Then we couldn't stop to turn the car back. And then we had stuck trying to miss the car of local fishermen, and pushed the car with hands!
We couldn't go too slowly afraid to stuck again, and couldn't go too fast because there were a lot of water pits under the snow.
That's why we saw the lake only through the trees and didn't have a stop there.
But we saw a ü¶å deer here in wildwood!
And that's why we have to change a route a little bit to go through the Naliboki agrotown.

title: Naliboki agrotown
text: During the times of the Polish‚ÄìLithuanian Commonwealth, since 1555 the settlement belonged to the family of the Radziwi≈Ç≈Ç magnates. Eventually, it has grown into a miasteczko. Since 1722 it was the home of a glass factory founded by Anna Radziwi≈Ç≈Ç, closed in 1862.
After the Second Partition of Poland, since 1793 it belonged to the Russian Empire. In 1896 it was part of Powiat oszmia≈Ñski Vilna Governorate, Russian Empire.

title: Elagma Shale guest house in Naliboki forest
Nesvizh castle
text: Nesvizh castle is one of the two most popular historical places in Belarus together with Mir castle.
There are a lot of info about it. But in two words the castle is a residential castle of the Radziwi≈Ç≈Ç family.

title: Hrusauka manor
text: It was one of the most interesting stops of our trip. Maybe, also because of the man who was not far from the manor and escorted us inside, telling the history of this place.

title: Milavidy memorial complex
text: This is the last point of our trip - a memorial complex in few kilometers from the Milavidy village, it was a battle during the January Uprising here in 1863.
The January Uprising (the Polish Uprising 1963-1964) was an insurrection against the Russian Empire aimed at the restoration of the Polish‚ÄìLithuanian Commonwealth.

title: üá¨üá™ Gorgeous and tasty Sakartvelo (Georgia)
text: A summer trip to a small and underrated country with unique nature, cuisine and culture.

title: Intro
text: üá¨üá™ **Georgia** (locals call it Sakartvelo) is a small country between üá∑üá∫ **Russia** on the north, Black sea on the west and üáπüá∑ **Turkey**, üá¶üá≤ **Armenia** and üá¶üáø **Azerbaijan** on the south and south-east.

üá¨üá™ **Georgia** is really rich for the tourists: it has the üåä sea, ‚õ∞Ô∏è mountains, üç≤ cuisine, and ‚õ™ culture. Everyone can find something interesting. Also, Georgians are üç∑ hospitable people, so feel yourself welcome guests here.

title: Batumi
text: **Batumi** is the second-largest city in the country. It's located on the coast of the Black Sea and offers a lot of entertainment for tourists.

title: Dancing fountains
text: Dancing ‚õ≤ fountains are a real miracle to unite people of all the cultures and ages. All the people here look happy to observe these dances.

title: Sea
text: **Batumi** is the city on the coast of the Black Sea. For many people, it's the main attraction here.

title: Botanical garden
text: The botanical garden is a famous place in **Batumi** to visit. It's not far from the city and it has an amazing collection of plants and üå≤ trees from over the world.

title: Gonio fortress
text: The next stop is the Gonio fortress. It is located on the other side (south) of the city.

title: Tbilisi
text: The next city that is definitely worth visiting is **Tbilisi**. The capital and the biggest city in the country. There is a 5.5h üöÜ train with AC from **Batumi** to Tbilisi.

title: Mtkvari river
text: As always the city has its own river. Its name Kura (the Georgian name of Kura is Mtkvari).

title: Bridge of Peace
text: The bridge was designed by an Italian architect. It had some criticism because it looks much more modern than the old town.

title: Metekhi St. Virgin Church
text: The Virgin Mary Assumption Church of Metekhi looks beautiful on the cliff by the river.

title: Anchiskhati Basilica
text: The ‚õ™ church was built by the King Dachi of Iberia (circa 522-534). It's the oldest surviving church in **Tbilisi**.

title: Rike park
text: This is the park you can easily get by the Bridge of Peace from the old town.

title: Mtatsminda park
text: Mtatsminda park is a nice city park on the top of the ‚õ∞Ô∏è mountain with great views of the city.

title: Leghvtakhevi canyon and waterfall
text: How many cities do you know with the canyon and waterfall in the center?

title: Sulphur baths
text: But probably the main place in the city is sulphur üõÄ baths. That's the reason the city was founded here.

title: Narikala fortress
text: Narikala fortress is an ancient fortress with another great view of the city. You can use a cable car or stairs to visit it.

title: Peace monument
text: There is a peace monument not far from **Gudauri**. One more viewpoint to the gorge. It can be found if you go to the ‚¨ÜÔ∏è North from **Gudauri**.

title: Kutaisi
text: **Kutaisi** is one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world and the third-most populous city in Georgia.

title: Okatse canyon
text: Okatse canyon is famous because of the road you must go through to visit it.

title: Prometheus cave
text: If you read The Lord of the Rings you had to imagine Moria. This cave looks exactly like the imagination.

title: Food
text: It's time to introduce the Georgian üç≤ cuisine. And it's really a lot of dishes there.

title: Chicken
text: There are several traditional dishes from chicken.

title: Vegetarian
text: There are also some hot dishes without meat.

title: Wine
text: Wine is a very traditional Georgian drink. They are really proud of it.

title: Outro
text: An interesting fact that proves one more time the uniqueness of the country: Georgians count not by 10, but by 20: not twenty, thirty, forty, but something like twenty, twenty and ten, two-twenty...

It's impossible to put all impressions on one page. I have no more space for amazing toasts by Vaja Davitadze, for stories about two crazy üèéÔ∏è drivers in Georgia and one in my country on the way home, and much more...
It was really nice trip, but I haven't been to **Svaneti** yet. Hope to return there one day.

title: ü¶â Zalessie owl house in spring and autumn
text: The ornithology paradise between swamps in the wild Bielavie≈æskaja pu≈°ƒça.

title: Intro
text: üå≤ **Zalessie** (_za lesom_ - behind the forest) is an almost extinct village in **Bielavie≈æskaja pu≈°ƒça** in Belarus.
It's also the name of the hostel house you can stay in (facebook.com/zalessie). Also, you can rent bicycles and kayaks here.
I have been there two times (in spring and üçÇ autumn) this year, because it's the kind of place you want to return to.
You will not find this place on booking or airbnb. It's a kind of filter for the guests of the house.

title: The owl house
text: The owl house is a really nice place to sleep. It's located so close to the forest so you can touch it from the terrace. You can feel yourself the part of nature but still in safety.

title: The forest
text: But the main attraction here is the forest. It's a natural museum. On the first trip, our host was our forest guide and showed some interesting places.
Ornithology is a hobby of our host. His profession is psychology. And this forest is a really good place for the **"pu≈°ƒçatherapy"**.

title: The birds
text: Unfortunately, I didn't have enough good üì∑ camera to take photos of the birds I have seen.
But this place is perfect for birdwatching. Wild forests and swamps are the ideal places for many kinds.

Watching the birds is really calm hobby, you are üö∂ walking in the forest and can collect photos of different birds and classify it. Try yourself if you haven't tried it yet. Just start from the closest part.
If you are not in this hobby yet it's hard to notice the birds, but with a good guide, it's not a problem.
I couldn't understand the uniquity of the birds I had watched. That's why I decided to start from the birds in the üèôÔ∏è city - the simplest ones.
Honestly, I had bought a binoculars and a bird's definer book and download the birds' application after this trip.
So, next time I will be more üí™ prepared.

title: bonus
text: The owner shared the üìó book he had created about tourism in these places with me. Feel free to download it here:
The cover: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1u1EK7zyfhPjh9SX0n8mx3UZsKMJf5elz/view
The book: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1nOz3zPaBIhA4FxbVtfSB3ba9ltenhTKJ/view

title: üá±üá∞ All-around Sri Lanka
text: Postponed by almost 2 years trip to the paradise-like island with amazing nature and traces of old civilization.

title: Intro
text: Sri Lanka (formerly known as Ceylon) is a fascinating destination for all kinds of tourists. You can try local cuisine, surfing and hiking, find the traces of old cities or enjoy rich nature with animals variety.

title: Dubai
text: Our path included a plane transfer in the United Arab Emirates. Dubai is a pretty modern city in the desert with many interesting places.

title: Hikkaduwa
text: But finally, we are in Hikkaduwa. This is a small village by the ocean. A nice place to stay if you like big ocean waves and would like to try yourself surfing.
There are several interesting things to do in Hikkaduwa: to visit a big turtle spot and the local temple Seenigama Sri Devol Maha Devalaya.
But the main two sides of Hikkaduwas are relaxation and surfing.

title: Sunsets and the Ocean
text: Hikkaduwa is situated on the west coast of Sri Lanka so you can meet the fabulous sunsets every evening here. It is impossible to add something to these photos. It's a view definitely worth seeing at least once.

title: Surfing
text: This is the other side of Hikkaduwa. Narigama beach has a nice spot for surfing even for beginners.
I am not a successful surfer but let me try to explain how it works. Surfing includes a lot of difficult parts:

1. Firstly, you need to get to the spot. The waves are pretty big near the bank and try to interfere with you. You go (on this step, it's better to hold the board behind you), then you swim (here, if you see the white wave it's better to leave the board and go down).

2. On the spot, you have to see the waves for yourself. Some of them are too big, and some of them are too small. The waves are grouped in sets. Probably it's one of the hardest parts - to find your wave. And it takes some time.

3. Finally, there is a wave. You have to puddle as quickly as possible to the bank on your board. Your legs are starting to go up and your head is going down. And here is a really difficult moment. You have to get up as quickly as possible. Only one jump from lying down to standing on the board. And the board is not stable at that moment, it's moving! The majority of beginners get up too late.

4. And the final part: your are on the wave. You are cool and happy but you have to remember about your position. If you are too behind you will stop pretty fast and the wave will go ahead without you.
Go to step 1.
If something went out of control you feel the how powerful ocean is. Even the small wave looks like tsunami when you are inside and you are absolutely helpless.
But if everything ok it's a really nice feeling. You are high above the sea and it feels like the board has a powerful motor to drag you forward.
One more advice: don't try to stay on board as long as possible. If you are losing the speed and the wave it's better to stop to save some strength going back not from the bank
If you want to tame even a softboard (for beginners) take into account that it will take a lot of time and strength. It requires many days.

title: Udawalawe National Park
text: Udawalawe is an elephant park. It has a lot of animals and birds, awesome trees and view. But the main character here is elephant, it's not a problem to find they here.

title: Ella - Nuwara Eliya
text: Our driver went to Nuwara Eliya to meet us but we chose another transport because this train path is one of the most breathtaking in the world.

title: Nuwara Eliya
text: People call this city old England. This is the coldest place on the island I have visited.

title: Damro tea factory
text: As I mentioned the city is famous because of tea plantations and tea factories. It exports tea over the world. And the women on these plantations from the ads from childhood are really here.

title: Pedro tea factory
text: Pedro tea factory is another factory to visit. It's interesting to compare everything with the first one. If you have time - why not?

title: Sri Pada (Adam's Peak)
text: Adam's Peak or Sri Pada is a sacred place on the island. It's not the tallest mountain but it is the most important for locals and tourists. The path to the top is not easy but every Lankan tries to do it at least once in a couple of years.

title: Kandy
text: We didn't plan to visit Kandy but there is no other way to our next destination. That's why we decided to make a stop to visit a famous Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic and to have lunch here. And we didn't regret it.

title: Sigiriya
text: Probably the most bright point, visiting card of the island, our trip culmination. Sigiriya rock fortress!
The best decoration for all Indiana Jones movies! You feel like in the movie here. It's hard to believe that this is real and so old.

title: Polonnaruwa
text: The next point is Polonnaruwa. This city is pretty well preserved. There is a museum with uniq exhibits.

title: Colombo
text: Time to say goodbye to our driver but our trip is not over yet. Colombo is not the capital but it's the biggest and the most modern city on the island.

title: Yala National Park
text: We returned to Hikkaduwa then relaxed for some time and decided to make one more one-day trip to the biggest and oldest national park on the island.
There are a lot of different animals here. Maybe, not so many particularly elephants compared to Udawalawe but it has even better views.
And the main character here is... the leopard. Every tourist wants to see it and every driver wants to show it.
The driver wanted to show us the best places, a couple of times I thought that we can roll over.
My camera didn't have zoom so you have to find the animals in some photos by yourself. But every photo has a description so it should be easier.

title: Animals
text: What about the animals in general. They live peacefully everywhere on the island. It looks like a big natural park.

title: Outro
text: Sri Lanka is a paradise-like place with magnificent nature where people and animals still live in peace. It has places for sport and for people who like history. Absolutely an all-around place.

title: üé≤ Board Games
text: Some board games I've played

title: A Game of Thrones: The Board Game (Second Edition) (2011)
Unmatched: Jurassic Park ‚Äì InGen vs Raptors (2020)
Xia: Legends of a Drift System (2014)
